intro: Cenostigma pinnatum var. oblongifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf cenostigma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the family Annonaceae.
